events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at an intersection during morning rush hour.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident based on details of the customer’s vehicle collision report.
An agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with the auto accident claim process and documentation.
The customer received official acknowledgment of the claim submission and was advised on next steps.
The company requested accident photos, police report, and repair estimates related to the vehicle collision for verification.
The customer submitted all requested documents including pictures of damages and the official police accident report.
The investigation into the vehicle collision claim began with review of documents and contacting involved parties.
The investigation concluded successfully, confirming the accident details and validating the customer's liability claims.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering the vehicle repair costs and related expenses for the auto accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciation for the timely handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved and payment processing was authorized to support vehicle repairs.
Payment covering the auto accident repair costs was issued to the customer’s designated bank account.
The auto accident claim was closed after successful payment and confirmation from the customer on repair completion.
The completed auto accident claim file was archived for future reference and record-keeping compliance.
